timeline.bodyText: There is no need for this "weird" variable here. Probably debugging context?
timeline.author: stavamichal

timeline.bodyText: You probably want this outside of "pre".
timeline.author: stavamichal
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -741,6 +745,7 @@ public HashedGenData call(ApiCaller ac, Deserializer parms) throws PerunExceptio
 	 +------User
 	 |        +-------Attrs (do NOT return member, member-resource attributes)
 	 +...
+	 * @deprecated - use getHashedHierarchicalData

timeline.bodyText: There is a bad indentation somewhere.
timeline.author: stavamichal
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -1107,6 +1112,7 @@ public ServiceAttributes call(ApiCaller ac, Deserializer parms) throws PerunExce | | +... +-----Vo .... + * @deprecated - use getHashedDataWithGroups */

timeline.message:
Core - extension of hashed data

* Some services couldn't be rewritten to use the new hashedData method
because they were using getDataWithVos or getFlatData. We have figured
out that we don't actually need to create new "hashed" version of these
methods. Insteady, we can reuse the already existing methods with some
minor modifications.
* The methods getHashedHierarchicalData and getHashedDataWithGroups now
also contains vo id in resource nodes and can return vo attributes.
* In the data provider class, there were some missuses of the emptyList
and singletonList methods that caused trouble, because they are
immutable.
* The old getData methods were annotated as deprecated in the API.

timeline.bodyText:
I'm not sure if our docs parser won't go crazy about it, since it already skips all that <pre> part above and doesnẗ handle more lines of param description.
Also it shows deprecation message on hover, so it will be like - use getHashedHierarchicalData. I would suggest to to remove leading dash.
timeline.author: zlamalp
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -479,7 +479,7 @@ public Service call(ApiCaller ac, Deserializer parms) throws PerunException { | +-------Attrs +... - * + * @deprecated - use getHashedHierarchicalData

timeline.message:
Core - extension of hashed data

* Some services couldn't be rewritten to use the new hashedData method
because they were using getDataWithVos or getFlatData. We have figured
out that we don't actually need to create new "hashed" version of these
methods. Insteady, we can reuse the already existing methods with some
minor modifications.
* The methods getHashedHierarchicalData and getHashedDataWithGroups now
also contains vo id in resource nodes and can return vo attributes.
* In the data provider class, there were some missuses of the emptyList
and singletonList methods that caused trouble, because they are
immutable.
* The old getData methods were annotated as deprecated in the API.

Core - extension of hashed data

* Some services couldn't be rewritten to use the new hashedData method
because they were using getDataWithVos or getFlatData. We have figured
out that we don't actually need to create new "hashed" version of these
methods. Insteady, we can reuse the already existing methods with some
minor modifications.
* The methods getHashedHierarchicalData and getHashedDataWithGroups now
also contains vo id in resource nodes and can return vo attributes.
* In the data provider class, there were some missuses of the emptyList
and singletonList methods that caused trouble, because they are
immutable.
* The old getData methods were annotated as deprecated in the API.
